meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.a: Study: A Little Booze Makes Workers More Creative

div.div: Tipsy employees find it hard to focus on a task, but this makes them more likely to come up with innovative ideas. This may help to explain the success of Silicon Valley, one of the last workplaces in America where hard and soft drinks still jostle for space in the company fridge.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/O7mo4b&via=Digg&text=Study: A Little Booze Makes Workers More Creative

div.a: Insane Clown Posse To Sue FBI

div.div: Every year, the FBI releases its National Gang Threat Assessment List, which examines "emerging gang trends and threats posed by criminal gangs and communities throughout the United States." In 2011, Juggalos were added to the list. Well, ICP is about to start fighting back, and they're reacting by suing the FBI.

div.a: Does Crazy Tape Actually Help Olympians Perform Better?

div.div: Along with snazzy racing outfits and sleek warm-up gear, many Olympians at the London Games have been accessorizing with athletic tape in various hues and patterns.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/NQOjCE&via=Digg&text=Does Crazy Tape Actually Help Olympians Perform Better?

div.a: What Lies Beneath The Streets Of New York City

div.div: New Yorkers go about unaware of what is happening just beneath their feet: Power pulses, information flies, and steam flows. The city’s infrastructure starts just below street level, but it doesn’t stop there.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PNcwr&via=Digg&text=What Lies Beneath The Streets Of New York City

div.a: An Ingenious Washing Machine Made Of Little More Than A Bucket

div.div: The time is nigh for foot-powered washing machines. Though the concept has been explored before, two recent projects are garnering attention for their real-world feasibility in alleviating the struggles associated with laundry in regions without easy access to electricity or running water.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/MV1uDR&via=Digg&text=An Ingenious Washing Machine Made Of Little More Than A Bucket

div.a: Every Trip To The Moon, Ever

div.div: Did you know that the United States and Soviet Union combined for eight failed missions to the moon within a single year?

div.a: Man In Bikini Trolls Chatroulette With 'Call Me Maybe'
Whats great about his is how many people just joined in as its so funny!
I'm going to be watching this for the rest of the day. #epic

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OaZEmC&via=Digg&text=Man In Bikini Trolls Chatroulette With 'Call Me Maybe'

div.a: Missing Olympic Athletes May Have Defected

div.div: Athletes from Cameroon -- five male boxers, a female footballer and a male swimmer -- walked away from the Olympic village last week, immediately raising questions about their intentions.
THE PRICE IS RIGHT — FOR YOU

div.a: How Much Is A Gallon Of Milk? It Depends Who You Are

div.div: It used to be that with dedication and a good pair of scissors, one grocery shopper could get the same coupons — and cheap prices — as another. Now going to the grocery store is becoming a lot less egalitarian.

div.a: Someone please tell me how this IS NOT considered illegal price discrimination under the Sherman Antitrust Act!

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OOGXRO&via=Digg&text=How Much Is A Gallon Of Milk? It Depends Who You Are

div.a: Beastie Boys Sue Monster Energy Drink For Copyright Infringement

div.div: This suit comes right after the news that founding member Adam Yauch– who died in May after a long battle with cancer — stated in his will that “In no event may my image or name or any music or any artistic property created by me be used for advertising purposes.”

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/NsnbKY&via=Digg&text=Beastie Boys Sue Monster Energy Drink For Copyright Infringement

div.div: A Twitter user has posted what appears to be an image from Microsoft's next-gen Kinect.

div.a: This Collection Of Old Apple Hardware Is Heroic

div.div: You are looking at a Russian collection of Apple computers, which one website thinks might be one of the largest outside of the U.S.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/P4A55a&via=Digg&text=This Collection Of Old Apple Hardware Is Heroic

div.a: Gmail Getting A New Login Page

div.div: Managing multiple accounts is becoming more important on the Web every day and Google has decided to make it easier for its Gmail users.
Forget using a calendar. This photograph of all the historic Batmobiles lined up not only stirs up nostalgic feelings, it gives us a sense of how much time has passed by.

div.a: Giant 3-D Printer To Make An Entire House In 20 Hours

div.div: 3-D printers can make airplanes and their parts, food and more — why not entire buildings?

div.a: Why build a house (like CAVEMEN) when you can print it out of a giant 3-D printer in 20 hours?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/MCVvCe&via=Digg&text=Giant 3-D Printer To Make An Entire House In 20 Hours

div.a: How London's Terrible Weather Made The Olympics Better

div.div: The UK’s appalling summer of weather could have had an unexpected benefit for Olympic athletes and spectators – it might have delivered one of the least polluted Games in history.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QLX9XA&via=Digg&text=How London's Terrible Weather Made The Olympics Better
